content.description: The most obvious crack line in the whole place, and one not to miss while you are here.  A straightforward jamming session plugging and chugging to the top.  I found a spot for a #3 cam, your mileage may vary; but hand size pieces are the best cracks anyhow.
content.protection: gear .4 to #3 will get ya up, no problems.  Bolted anchor on top.
content.location: just a few meters right of "Little Bunny's Mother"  Can't miss it, clean rock, lazer crack.

content.description:
Spot the first little roof while walking up to the crag, and the lazer line that cut just to its left, and you are exactly where you want to be.  Jam your way up the obvious crack, do some body english to pass the roof on the left and reach for the thank gawd jug above if you suck at jamming, or or just the thank gawd jug cuz the hard part is over.

Climb the remaining narrowing crack to the top anchor located above and slightly left.  As of 5/17/2020 the anchor consists of a bunch of webbing around a block, but can be backed up with a #3 or a #2 if needed.
content.location: This is the second established route on the wall (L to R)  It's located where the rock turns from a dark color to a more reddish color on the far left side of the wall.

content.description: Easily TRd off the anchors on "Kill the Wabbit", this climb climbs between to columns offering a few chimney moves, as well as excellent hand and foot jams when needed.
content.location: One crack system right of "Kill the Wabbit" and shares the anchors.

content.description: This is a chimney of a climb located in a small alcove between two columns.  Bring the wide gear, and use it all in the multiple cracks found in the back of the chimney.  You can easily top rope this climb from the anchors on "Little Bunny's Mother"
content.protection: Up to a #6?  IDK as I don't own that gear and only TR's the line.
content.location: This is the first established route on the wall.  Located just left of the obvious "Little Bunny's Mother"

content.description: So far, this is my favorite route at the crag.  Certainly not a looker, this climb has excellent movement, great pro, and varied climbing the whole way.  Jams, arm bars, sidepulls, finger locks, crimps, it goes on and on.  DO THIS ROUTE!
content.protection: gear to a #3, bolted anchors on top.
content.location: Around the corner if you will from "Kill the Wabbit" line it up with the picture here, its just easier that way.
